# Summary of Article: "Halliburton (HAL) Price Target Increased by 13.94% to 36.67"

**Source:** Nasdaq (content from Fintel)

## Key Facts and Statistics:

1. **Price Target Revision:**
   - Average one-year price target increased to **$36.67/share** (up 13.94% from prior estimate of $32.19 dated January 11, 2026)
   - Price target range: Low of $28.28 to high of $42.00/share
   - Average price target represents 11.71% increase from latest closing price of **$32.83/share**

2. **Institutional Ownership:**
   - 1,489 funds/institutions hold positions (decrease of 122 owners, or 7.57% in last quarter)
   - Average portfolio weight: 0.16% (increase of 8.00%)
   - Total institutional shares: 850,141K shares (decreased 2.91% in last three months)

3. **Options Sentiment:**
   - Put/call ratio: **0.87** (described as indicating a bullish outlook)

4. **Major Institutional Holders:**
   - Capital Research Global Investors: 91,030K shares (10.82% ownership) - increased holdings by 45.01%
   - Charles Schwab Investment Management: 30,654K shares (3.64% ownership) - increased by 1.19%
   - Sanders Capital: 26,005K shares (3.09% ownership) - increased by 8.61%
   - VTSMX - Vanguard Total Stock Market Index: 24,841K shares (2.95% ownership) - increased by 1.28%
   - VFINX - Vanguard 500 Index Fund: 24,403K shares (2.90% ownership) - increased by 1.14%

**Note:** This article appears to be a data-driven report from Fintel aggregating analyst price targets and institutional ownership data.
</Summary>

# Summary of Article: Short Interest in Halliburton Company Increases By 23.6%

## Key Facts and Statistics:

**Short Interest Data:**
- Short interest increased 23.6% in January
- As of January 15th: 32,525,256 shares short (up from 26,321,090 on December 31st)
- 3.9% of company's shares are currently short sold
- Days-to-cover ratio: 1.8 days (based on average daily trading volume of 18,015,354 shares)

**Stock Performance:**
- Opening price on Tuesday (article date): $32.77
- 50-day moving average: $29.86
- 200-day moving average: $25.83
- 12-month low: $18.72
- 12-month high: $35.55
- Market capitalization: $27.58 billion
- P/E ratio: 21.70
- PEG ratio: 2.00
- Beta: 0.77

**Financial Metrics:**
- Current ratio: 2.04
- Quick ratio: 1.51
- Debt-to-equity ratio: 0.68
- Return on equity: 19.77%
- Net margin: 5.78%

**Q4 Earnings (announced January 21st):**
- EPS: $0.69 (beat consensus estimate of $0.55 by $0.14)
- Revenue: $5.66 billion (exceeded consensus estimate of $5.39 billion)
- Revenue up 0.8% year-over-year
- Prior year same quarter EPS: $0.73

**Dividend Information:**
- Quarterly dividend: $0.17 (paid December 24th)
- Annualized dividend: $0.68
- Dividend yield: 2.1%
- Payout ratio: 45.03%

## Analyst Ratings:

**Recent Price Target Changes:**
- Evercore ISI: Raised target from $35 to $36 (in-line rating) - January 22nd
- JPMorgan Chase: Raised target from $30 to $35 (overweight rating) - January 22nd
- Morgan Stanley: Reissued overweight rating with $35 target - January 21st
- Bank of America: Raised target from $24 to $26 (buy rating) - October 14th
- Zacks Research: Upgraded from "strong sell" to "hold" - October 23rd

**Overall Analyst Consensus:**
- 2 analysts: Strong Buy
- 14 analysts: Buy
- 8 analysts: Hold
- Average rating: "Moderate Buy"
- Consensus target price: $34.76

## Insider Trading:
- EVP Van H. Beckwith sold 54,348 shares on January 23rd at $34.96/share (total: $1,900,006.08) - representing 13.63% decrease in position
- CEO Jeffrey Allen Miller sold 171,200 shares on January 23rd at $34.96/share (total: $5,985,152) - representing 13.45% decrease in ownership
- Total insider sales over 90 days: 497,002 shares worth $15,889,138
- Company insiders own 0.61% of stock

## Institutional Investor Activity:
- 85.23% of company stock owned by hedge funds and institutional investors
- Several institutions increased holdings in Q3-Q4, with modest percentage increases
</Summary>

<Summary source="https://www.palmettograin.com/news/story/10333/halliburton-company-stock-analyst-estimates-ratings">
# Summary of Article: Palmetto Grain Brokerage on Halliburton (HAL)

## Key Facts and Statistics:

**Company Overview:**
- Market cap: approximately $28.2 billion
- Based in Houston, Texas
- Serves global energy industry across oil and gas well lifecycle

**Stock Performance:**
- Past 52 weeks: HAL stock climbed 32.8% vs. S&P 500's 15.4%
- Year-to-date 2026: HAL up 19.9% vs. S&P 500's 1.1%
- Outperformed State Street Energy Select Sector SPDR ETF (XLE), which gained 17.2% over past year and 15.6% YTD

**Q4 2025 Results (announced Jan. 21):**
- Stock rallied 4.1% on announcement day
- Revenue: $5.7 billion (up marginally year-over-year, beat estimates of $5.4 billion)
- Adjusted EPS: $0.69 (down 1.4% year-over-year, beat estimates of $0.54)

**2026 Outlook:**
- Management expects Q4 momentum to carry forward
- Fiscal year 2026 analyst projections: diluted EPS of $2.26 (representing 6.6% year-over-year decline)
- Halliburton has beaten EPS expectations in 2 of past 4 quarters and met estimates in remaining 2
- Company prioritizing shareholder value through dividends and share buybacks

## Analyst Opinions (Named Sources):

**Overall Wall Street Rating:** "Moderate Buy"
- 12 analysts: "Strong Buy"
- 3 analysts: "Moderate Buy"
- 9 analysts: "Hold"
- 1 analyst: "Strong Sell"
- Sentiment largely unchanged from three months prior (when 13 analysts rated "Strong Buy")

**Stifel analyst Stephen Gengaro (Jan. 21):**
- Raised price target to $35 from $32
- Maintained "Buy" rating
- Highlighted Halliburton's leadership in U.S. well development
- Noted international activity and pricing could provide meaningful tailwinds

**Price Targets:**
- Average analyst price target: $35.67 (implies 5.3% upside from current levels)
- Street-high target: $41 (implies 21.1% gain)
</Summary>

<Summary source="https://www.inkl.com/news/eversource-stock-analyst-estimates-ratings">
# Summary of Article: "Eversource Stock: Analyst Estimates & Ratings"

**Note:** This article is about Eversource Energy (ES), not Halliburton Company (HAL). It does not contain information relevant to forecasting HAL's stock price movement.

## Key Facts:
- **Company:** Eversource Energy (ES), a utility holding company founded in 1927
- **Market cap:** $25.7 billion
- **Stock performance:**
  - Past 52 weeks: +17.6%
  - Year-to-date 2026: +1.4%
  - Outperformed S&P 500 (14% over past year) and utilities sector ETF (XLU, 11% over past year)

## Q3 2025 Earnings (reported Nov. 4):
- Revenue: $3.2 billion (beat estimates)
- Adjusted EPS: $1.19 (beat estimates by 6.3%)
- Stock fell 1.2% after earnings due to $75 million charge from offshore wind project liabilities

## Forward-Looking Estimates:
- Fiscal year 2025 expected adjusted EPS: $4.75 (3.9% year-over-year increase)
- Strong earnings surprise history (beat or met estimates in past four quarters)

## Analyst Ratings:
- Consensus: "Hold"
- 4 "Strong Buys," 8 "Holds," 1 "Moderate Sell," 2 "Strong Sells"
- Sentiment becoming more bearish (two fewer "Strong Buy" ratings than three months ago)
- Mean price target: $72.92 (6.9% upside)
- Street-high target: $85 (24.6% upside)

**Relevance to HAL forecast question:** None - this article discusses a different company entirely.
</Summary>

<Summary source="https://www.barchart.com/story/news/36954815/is-halliburton-stock-a-buy-sell-or-hold-for-january-2026">
# Summary of "Is Halliburton Stock a Buy, Sell, or Hold for January 2026?"

**Source:** Barchart.com, January 08, 2026, by Anushka Dutta

## Key Facts and Statistics:

- **HAL stock price movement:** Gained 8% intraday on Jan. 5, 2026, but gave up some gains the next day
- **52-week performance:** Up 17% over past 52 weeks; up 43% over past six months
- **Recent performance:** Reached 52-week high of $33.03 on Jan. 5; down roughly 3% from that level as of article date; up 12% over past five days
- **Market cap:** $25.5 billion
- **Forward P/E ratio:** 14 times

## Q3 FY2025 Results (reported Oct. 21):
- Revenue: $5.6 billion (down 1.7% YOY, beat estimate of $5.39 billion)
- Adjusted EPS: $0.58 (down 20% YOY, beat estimate of $0.50)
- Announced quarterly savings of $100 million and capital budget reset for 2026

## Analyst Projections:
- **Q4 FY2025 EPS forecast:** $0.54 (down 23% YOY)
- **Full FY2025 EPS forecast:** $2.26 (down 24% YOY)

## Analyst Ratings and Price Targets:

**Downgrades/Cautions:**
- Freedom Capital Markets: Downgraded, citing weak fundamental backdrop despite strong rally

**Upgrades/Positive:**
- Barclays (David Anderson): "Equal Weight" rating, raised price target from $25 to $30
- Citi: Raised price target from $31 to $33, "Buy" rating; believes industry at "bottom of a two-year downcycle"
- Rothschild: Initiated coverage with "Buy" rating; expects industry recovery as upstream investments pick up
- Goldman Sachs (Neil Mehta): "Buy" rating, raised price target from $25 to $28

**Consensus:**
- 24 analysts total: 12 "Strong Buy," 3 "Moderate Buy," 9 "Hold" = "Moderate Buy" consensus
- Consensus price target: $31.70 (marginal downside from current levels)
- Street-high price target: $41 (28% upside potential)

## Venezuela Opportunity Context:
- Oil prices surged following U.S. military capture and extradition of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro
- President Trump announced U.S. oil companies would invest "billions of dollars" in Venezuela
- Venezuela holds roughly 17% of world's proven crude reserves but has aging infrastructure and low production
- According to Francisco Monaldi (Director, Latin American Energy Program, Rice University's Baker Institute), reaching Venezuela's 1970s peak of 3.5 million bpd would cost approximately $10 billion annually
- Author notes this opportunity requires considerable time and investment

## Additional Business Development:
- Strategic collaboration announced with Volta Grid for distributed power generation for data centers worldwide, with initial deployment in Middle East

## Author's Conclusion:
HAL stock "might be a buy for investors with a risk appetite" given potential gains from Venezuela, rising electricity demand from data centers, and moderately bullish analyst sentiment.
</Summary>

<Summary source="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/swks-q4-deep-dive-broad-053602187.html">
# Summary of Article: SWKS Q4 Deep Dive

**Date:** February 04, 2026

**Company Focus:** Skyworks Solutions (NASDAQ: SWKS) - a wireless chips maker

## Key Facts and Statistics:

**Q4 CY 2025 Results:**
- Revenue: $1.04 billion (3.1% year-on-year decline, but beat analyst estimates of $1.00 billion by 3.4%)
- Adjusted EPS: $1.54 (beat analyst estimates of $1.40 by 10.1%)
- Adjusted EBITDA: $325 million (31.4% margin, 17.1% beat vs estimates of $277.5 million)
- Operating Margin: 10% (down from 16.9% in same quarter last year)
- Inventory Days Outstanding: 115 (up from 105 in previous quarter)
- Market Capitalization: $8.32 billion

**Q1 CY 2026 Guidance:**
- Revenue guidance: $900 billion at midpoint (above analyst estimates of $871.5 million)
- Note: The article states "$900 billion" which appears to be a typo and likely should be "$900 million"
- Adjusted EPS guidance: $1.04 at midpoint (above analyst estimates of $0.96)

## Named Source Opinions:

- **CEO Philip Brace:** Attributed results to "robust execution in flagship mobile programs and expanding design wins in Wi-Fi 7 and automotive connectivity," noting that "smartphone replacement cycles are beginning to shorten"

- **CFO Philip Carter:** Stated that "gross margin will be affected by typical seasonal patterns and product mix, but the company is committed to maintaining cost discipline"

## Additional Context:

- Growth drivers include edge IoT, automotive, and data center segments
- Company is progressing on a planned combination with Qorvo, expected to "diversify the business and drive long-term synergies"
- Management prioritizing R&D investment for next-generation Wi-Fi and data center architectures

**Disclaimer:** This article is about Skyworks Solutions (SWKS), not Halliburton (HAL), so it has limited direct relevance to the forecasting question.
</Summary>

<Agent_report>
Query: Provide HAL daily close prices for the past 365 trading days up to 2026-02-04, compute distribution of 8-day percentage moves, summarize mean, median, 25th and 75th percentiles; list any company events, macro or industry events (earnings releases, conference presentations, OPEC meetings, EIA reports) scheduled between 2026-02-05 and 2026-02-13 that historically impact oilfield services stocks.
The available search results let us firm-up most of the qualitative (calendar) portion of the original request, but they are still insufficient for the quantitative (price-series) work.

1. 365 trading-day close-price vector (5 Feb 2025 – 4 Feb 2026)
• Only a small slice of daily closes is presently available.  FinancialContent shows the most recent 45 trading days (2 Dec 2025 – 4 Feb 2026) with valid NYSE closes such as 34.34 on 4-Feb-2026 and 29.60 on 2-Jan-2026 (FinancialContent list).  
• Macrotrends confirms the 4-Feb-2026 close (34.34) and offers long-term annual averages but not the required daily granularity (Macrotrends page).
• Neither source provides the remaining ~320 trading days back to 5-Feb-2025.  The Stooq directory structure (Free Market Data page; MSSQLTips walk-through cited earlier) and the Alpha Vantage API documentation (Alpha Vantage) both indicate that a full, no-cost CSV can be downloaded, but the actual HAL time-series file has not yet been pulled.

Without the full close-price vector:
 • The 8-day percentage-move series (~357 observations) cannot be calculated.  
 • Consequently the mean, median, 25th and 75th percentile statistics that the user asked for remain outstanding.

2. Event calendar: 5 Feb 2026 – 13 Feb 2026
Items that historically move oil-service equities are now documented:

Company / industry conferences
• SPE Hydraulic Fracturing Technology Conference – final day 5-Feb-2026; Halliburton is an exhibitor (Halliburton event page).
• Kuwait Oil & Gas Show (KOGS) – final day 5-Feb-2026; Halliburton listed as exhibitor (carried forward from prior rounds).

Macro / commodity data releases
• Baker Hughes North-America rig count – weekly prints due Friday 6-Feb (already out) and Friday 13-Feb-2026 at 13:00 ET (Investing.com economic calendar; Pipe Exchange running table).
• EIA Weekly Petroleum Status Report – Wednesday 11-Feb-2026 (EIA calendar).
• U.S. Employment Situation (January 2026) – Friday 11-Feb-2026 (BLS calendar referenced earlier).
• U.S. CPI (January 2026) – Friday 13-Feb-2026 (Investing.com calendar).
• No OPEC+ ministerial or Monthly Oil Market Report falls in the window (current OPEC schedule checked previously).

Unresolved calendar item
• February-2026 IEA Oil Market Report: the exact publication day (usually mid-month) is still unverified.

Company-specific investor events
• Halliburton’s Q4-2025 earnings call took place 21-Jan-2026 (RTTNews), so no earnings or sell-side conference for HAL is scheduled within 5–13 Feb.

3. Remaining information gaps
Quantitative:
 • Full daily close series (5-Feb-2025 → 4-Feb-2026).
 • Computation of 8-day %-move distribution and its summary statistics.

Qualitative:
 • Confirm the exact release date of the IEA February-2026 Oil Market Report.
 • Quick refresh of Halliburton IR/event pages to catch any newly-added presentation inside the window (low probability but prudent).

4. Recommended next research actions
A. Retrieve HAL daily closes  
 Option 1 – Stooq: download d_us_txt.zip, extract hal.us.txt and filter the specified date range.  
 Option 2 – Alpha Vantage: call TIME_SERIES_DAILY_ADJUSTED with outputsize=full and datatype=csv, then slice the same dates.

B. Calculate 8-day percentage moves and descriptive statistics using Python/Excel.

C. Search for the exact date of the IEA February-2026 Oil Market Report.

Until those additional data pulls are executed, the answer cannot provide the numeric distribution requested by the original query.</Agent_report>
